Articles.Content: So I want to change focus from one spacecraft to another (around 30m apart) without having to leave the current mission and switch over. Is there something I press? (I use a mac, so i might be different)

Should be the ] or [ keys. I believe they are the same on Mac.

Also, a favorite page that gets posted often: [http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Key_bindings](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Key_bindings)

Cheers,

~Claw

The wiki is in multiple languages. You can change the language at the sidebar on the left. Here's for example the german Key Binding Wiki page: [http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Key_bindings/de](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Key_bindings/de)

![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

In my experience so far on international keyboards, at least one of the keys is to the right of P as seen on this image.

![wGo7E1S.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/wGo7E1S.jpg)

This is what it looks like on my keyboard. The **Ãƒâ€¦**-key is one of them. Haven't found the other.

![TEhAnPT.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/TEhAnPT.jpg)
Settings menu -> Input -> Game, and set the "Focus Next Vessel" and "Focus Previous Vessel" keys to whatever you need.
